node.title: Spotify Is Removing Neil Young Songs After He Complains of ‘Misinformation’
node.alt: Neil Young, left, moved to take his music off of Spotify after complaining that it gave a platform to the podcaster Joe Rogan, right, who has been dismissive of the coronavirus vaccine.
node.description: The singer had warned that he would leave the streaming service because it gives a platform to Joe Rogan, whom scientists accused of promoting falsehoods about coronavirus vaccines.
node.content: ["Neil Young wasn\u2019t bluffing.", "Spotify confirmed on Wednesday that it has begun removing Young\u2019s music from the streaming service, two days after the star briefly posted a public letter calling on Spotify to choose between him and Joe Rogan, the star podcast host who has been accused of spreading disinformation about the coronavirus and vaccines.", "\u201cWe want all the world\u2019s music and audio content to be available to Spotify users,\u201d Spotify said in a statement. \u201cWith that comes great responsibility in balancing both safety for listeners and freedom for creators. We have detailed content policies in place and we\u2019ve removed over 20,000 podcast episodes related to Covid since the start of the pandemic. We regret Neil\u2019s decision to remove his music from Spotify, but hope to welcome him back soon.\u201d", "Young\u2019s music was expected to be fully removed from Spotify within hours. The news that Spotify was removing Young\u2019s music was first reported by The Wall Street Journal.", "In his letter, which Young had addressed to his label, Warner Records, and his manager, he said: \u201cSpotify has a responsibility to mitigate the spread of misinformation on its platform. I want you to let Spotify know immediately TODAY that I want all my music off their platform.\u201d", "He added: \u201cThey can have Rogan or Young. Not both.\u201d", "The letter was removed from Young\u2019s website soon after it was posted, though it drew wide news media attention.", "Rogan, whose show \u201cThe Joe Rogan Experience\u201d is the most popular podcast on Spotify, has come under fire for an episode on Dec. 31 that featured Dr. Robert Malone, an infectious-disease expert.", "This month, hundreds of scientists, professors and public health experts asked Spotify to take down the episode, which they said promoted \u201cseveral falsehoods about Covid-19 vaccines.\u201d", "Rogan, a comedian and actor, signed an exclusive podcast deal with Spotify in 2020 that has been reported to be worth $100 million, though Spotify has not confirmed that figure.", "Spotify has not commented on Young\u2019s request, and a representative of the company did not immediately respond to a request for comment on Wednesday. But Spotify has defended Rogan in the past, including after an episode that featured the conspiracy theorist Alex Jones in 2020.", "\u201cWe want creators to create,\u201d Daniel Ek, the chief executive and co-founder of Spotify, told The Financial Times then. \u201cIt\u2019s what they do best. We\u2019re not looking to play a role in what they should say.\u201d", "Spotify has 318 million monthly listeners around the world, including 172 million who pay for subscriptions, according to the company\u2019s most recent financial disclosures."]
